main event: A couple observed a bright light in the southern sky in Silver Springs, Maryland on 12 August 66, thinking it was a meteor, but it displayed unusual motion.
interesting points: The object moved slowly in a northeasterly direction and suddenly disappeared., The initial location of the object was between Altair and Deneb., The witness described the object as larger and brighter than a meteor., During the sighting, a smaller object followed the same path and disappeared., The sighting lasted approximately 10-15 minutes.
sighted object: a bright light resembling a star
witness description: an amateur astronomer and their spouse
